TopicTitle: Deployed Science on ground but says it is not

Articles.Content: I know it's a mod that I'm running, but rather than remove each one and reinstall, I'm going to ask if anyone else knows which mod may be causing the issue. I put deployed science on the ground, it says it is not on the surface of a planet. Deployed just out of KSC by all 3 types and same results. Mod list is extensive, so I'm just asking before I get into extensive details. I have yet to test on other body due to not working at home. Used to work with these mods with 1.7.3. I just hadn't used them since then.

50 minutes ago, Tiger1357 said:

I know it's a mod that I'm running, but rather than remove each one and reinstall, I'm going to ask if anyone else knows which mod may be causing the issue. I put deployed science on the ground, it says it is not on the surface of a planet. Deployed just out of KSC by all 3 types and same results. Mod list is extensive, so I'm just asking before I get into extensive details. I have yet to test on other body due to not working at home. Used to work with these mods with 1.7.3. I just hadn't used them since then.

Did yo try deploying them further away from the KSC?

On KSC grounds.. just outside and close to a bayobob tree. Same results. Deployed Science not on surface of a planet.

Edited January 16, 2020 by Tiger1357
Mod list added
Update: The affecting mod has already repaired the issue. Not sure which one it was, but I just deployed all I had and they responded to being on a planet. I knew I just needed to say something.

I know this has already been solved, but just in case anyone else has this trouble, the mod that was responsible is World Stabilizer.

World Stabilizer changes the way that things contact the ground when they load in, so it makes sense that it was the culprit. The mod author simply exempted the Breaking Ground experiments from being stabilized.

Edited January 17, 2020 by HvP
